description: Users may experience failed authentication attempts when using Windows Hello on devices with security updates released in June 2023 or earlier. Beginning February 15, 2024, Microsoft will enforce a security hardening that disallows Windows Hello authentication requests from these outdated machines. This issue directly impacts the authentication process, especially for Single Sign-On (SSO) capabilities on Windows devices. The related CVE is CVE-2023-36871, which underlines the importance of keeping systems updated to avoid disruptions in access controls. System administrators should ensure that compatible updates are installed to maintain seamless authentication workflows.
